comment: Smart Data models - DRLC schema derived from the open connectivity foundation repository https://github.com/openconnectivityfoundation/IoTDataModels adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OCF/master/DRLC/schema.json
description: This Resource describes any to be applied or currently being applied DRLC signal.The Property 'DRType' is the ApplianceLoadReductionType defined in Zigbee/HA Smart Energy Profile 2.0.The Property 'start' is a string containing an RFC3339 encoded start time.The Property 'duration' value is in minutes.The Property 'Override' indicates whether the consumer has overridden the request (true) or not (false).The Resource provides the current DRLC action that is being applied.A duration of 0 (zero) means that no DR

contents.name: DRType
contents.comment: The to be applied demand-response type.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: drlevel
contents.comment: Indicator of the strength of the DR response that is requested; 0-0%, 1-30%, 2-50%, 3-70%

contents.name: duration
contents.comment: The duration of the to be applied DR type in minutes. A value of 0 means no applied DR.

contents.name: mandate
contents.comment: Whether overriding the DR request by the consumer is allowed

contents.name: override
contents.comment: Whether the consumer has overriden the application of DR.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: start
contents.comment: The start time for the application of DR.

contents.name: if
contents.comment: The OCF Interface set supported by this Resource.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
